messages.subject: Party food was: Re:  unschoolers without tv's?
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: SandraDodd@aol.com To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 2004 10:27 AM Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion]
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 2004 10:27 AM
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] unschoolers without tv's?



Hey, I hadn't thought of that!

I used to eat lots of party food too. Now I don't.
My kids never have.

Sandra
------------------

That's all very interesting and thinking back to parties Margaux went to without me, I'd always ask about the food. At the last party she went to over labor day, she said she had some pretzels and two cups of soda. Said the lady wouldn't let her have any more soda. But there were all kinds of goodies there, and she just ate pretzels. Also made me realize that I don't keep enough soda on hand for her. Yes, that's my own thing. I get her candy, and pretty much whatever she asks for, but I don't get soda. She doesn't ask though. Hmmmm... funny. I'll have to watch her a little more when we're in the soda aisles. I used to buy a lot of diet soda, but didn't want her to drink it, so I'd split it with her. Yeah, that doesn't make any sense at all. Oy. Lately, though, I've been getting her and my husband some regular soda. Hmm, yeah, better watch the sitch more closely.

:o)
Thanks,
Nichole

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
